instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with no video. After so troubleshooting i found that <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is missing on pin 1 of the <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> chip. This single comes from the PCH. Am i correct in assuming that i have a dead PCH and this board should head to the bin or am i missing something? Also this board does turn on and chime. Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: voltage on pin 4 of LCD connector?

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
[SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video Missing <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I figured it out. The LCD i was using must be bad. I grabbed another assembly and i have back light and a image. Well broken screen image but still an image.
